result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathleen D Forma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $100 inclusive of costs, to be paid by 9/9/2023.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cathleen D Forma

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $ 1090.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/09/2022  to pay $45.00/monthly.  Final payment due by 10/09/2024. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    CHRISTIAN THOMAS  $1,090.00
signed and filed

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Cathleen D Forma.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a final pretrial. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. 

Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the State. Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Sec. 63.01, Wis. Stats., to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $100 inclusive of costs, to be paid by 9/9/2023.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.
Received and Filed. Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Status Conference.
Defense advises the court case is in trial posture and  request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
Signed and filed. Copy emailed to attorney Christian Thomas.

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court with attorney Andrew Golden on behalf of Christopher S. Hammond.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference.  Court is in receipt of defense motion to withdraw as counsel. Court Granted defense motion to withdraw as counsel and ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel. 

Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Christian Thomas to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: via Zoom
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to w/ithdraw, forwarded to the Judge.

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court with attorney Christopher S. Hammond.  Julie Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
Case in court for a Status Conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 
This hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case is NOT a DV intimate partner case. Per the intake schedule, case will be reassigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley. Parties notified.

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court with Attorney Christopher S. Hammond.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for  Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  The matter was held in person.  Defense has requested the matter to be returned back to the TRIAL COURT.  The  Court grants defense request. The matter was scheduled in Branch 29 Judge Kiefer in person.

  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No VIOLENT Contact Order with Z.D.S.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cathleen D Forma in court with attorney Christopher S. Hammond.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cathleen D Forma appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.   Defendant waives In Person appearance.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
Case adjourned for entry into DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
